solution_line_template: Each pie needs {fruit_per_pie} pounds of fruit so for {num_peach_pies} Peach pies, {fruit_per_pie}*{num_peach_pies}=<<{fruit_per_pie}*{num_peach_pies}={pounds_peaches}>>{pounds_peaches} pounds of fruit
{fruit_per_pie} pounds of fruit for {num_apple_pies} apple pies is {fruit_per_pie}*{num_apple_pies} = <<{fruit_per_pie}*{num_apple_pies}={pounds_apples}>>{pounds_apples} pounds

{fruit_per_pie} pounds of fruit for {num_blueberry_pies} blueberry pies is {fruit_per_pie}*{num_blueberry_pies} = <<{fruit_per_pie}*{num_blueberry_pies}={pounds_blueberries}>>{pounds_blueberries} pounds

He needs {pounds_apples} pounds of apples and {pounds_blueberries} pounds of blueberries so {pounds_apples}+{pounds_blueberries} = <<{pounds_apples}+{pounds_blueberries}={total_pounds_apples_blueberries}>>{total_pounds_apples_blueberries}

{total_pounds_apples_blueberries} pounds of fruit at ${cost_apples_blueberries_per_pound} per pound is {total_pounds_apples_blueberries}*{cost_apples_blueberries_per_pound} = $<<{total_pounds_apples_blueberries}*{cost_apples_blueberries_per_pound}={cost_apples_blueberries}>>{cost_apples_blueberries}

{pounds_peaches} pounds of peaches will cost ${cost_peaches_per_pound} per pound so {pounds_peaches}*{cost_peaches_per_pound} = $<<{pounds_peaches}*{cost_peaches_per_pound}={cost_peaches}>>{cost_peaches}

The apple and blueberries will cost ${cost_apples_blueberries} and the peaches will cost ${cost_peaches} so {cost_apples_blueberries}+{cost_peaches} = $<<{cost_apples_blueberries}+{cost_peaches}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
